intro: Noccaea cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved honesty, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy texture. Noccaea cuneifolia is typically found in disturbed soils and is often seen growing along roadsides or in meadows.
